Authors:
Chiung-Chih Chang, Chi-Yu Chen, Wen-Wen Lin, Yu-Shen Shih,
Hsiao-Wei Kao
Title:
Mycena brunneisetosa, Mycena fengguans and Mycena
turandotiana, two new species and one new record of spinose Mycena from
Taiwan
Abstract:
Two new species and one new record of spinose Mycena were
described from Taiwan. They are characterized by having the unicellular
and erected spinose pilesetae on the surface of pileipellis. The two new
species (M. turandotiana and M. fengguans) have their pileocystidia
originated from hyphae of the pileipellis and have thin-walled
pileocystidia. While the new record (M. brunneisetosa) has thick-walled
pileocystia. Phylogenetic analyses support that the spinose structures
in those of Mycena resulted from convergent evolution.
